One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 50 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues B. You chose return and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues A, B, D. You chose SPACE and saw Invalid choice.
Round 3: Available cues C. You chose return and saw Invalid choice.
Round 4: Available cues A, B. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 5: Available cues B. You chose with and saw Invalid choice.
Round 6: Available cues A. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 7: Available cues C, D. You chose enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues A. You chose return and saw Invalid choice.
Round 9: Available cues A, B, D. You chose CTRL and saw Invalid choice.
Round 10: Available cues C. You chose . and saw Invalid choice.
Round 11: Available cues A, C, D. You chose A and saw RED.
Round 12: Available cues A, C. You chose SPACE and saw Invalid choice.
Round 13: Available cues B, C. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 14: Available cues A, B. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 15: Available cues A, C. You chose RETURN and saw Invalid choice.
Round 16: Available cues A, B, D. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 17: Available cues A. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 18: Available cues B, C. You chose B and saw RED.
Round 19: Available cues B, D. You chose . and saw Invalid choice.
Round 20: Available cues A, B. You chose for and saw Invalid choice.
Round 21: Available cues B, C. You chose . and saw Invalid choice.
Round 22: Available cues A, C. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 23: Available cues C, D. Based on previous observations, choose one cue by responding with just the letter. You press <<

FINAL_ACCUMULATED_PROMPT:
----------------------------------------
You will play a game with 50 rounds.
In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 50 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues C, D. You chose enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues D. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 3: Available cues B. You chose c and saw Invalid choice.
Round 4: Available cues A, D. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 5: Available cues A. You chose b and saw Invalid choice.
Round 6: Available cues A, C, D. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 7: Available cues A, B, D. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues A, C. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 9: Available cues A, C. You chose CTRL and saw Invalid choice.
Round 10: Available cues A, B, D. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 11: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 12: Available cues C. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 13: Available cues C. You chose a and saw Invalid choice.
Round 14: Available cues B. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 15: Available cues B, C. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.

Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution

FINAL_ACCUMULATED_PROMPT:
----------------------------------------
You will play a game with 50 rounds.
In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 50 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues D. You chose RETURN and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues A, B. You chose NO and saw Invalid choice.
Round 3: Available cues A. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 4: Available cues B, D. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 5: Available cues A, B, C. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 6: Available cues A, C. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 7: Available cues A. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues C. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.

One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 50 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues C. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues A, B, D. You chose letter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 3: Available cues B, C, D. You chose KEY and saw Invalid choice.
Round 4: Available cues C, D. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 5: Available cues A, D. You chose enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 6: Available cues A, C. You chose YOUR and saw Invalid choice.
Round 7: Available cues A, C. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues B, C, D. You chose RETURN and saw Invalid choice.
Round 9: Available cues B, C. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 10: Available cues C, D. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 11: Available cues A, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 12: Available cues A, B, D. You chose C and saw Invalid choice.
Round 13: Available cues C. You chose RETURN and saw Invalid choice.
Round 14: Available cues A, C, D. You chose RETURN and saw Invalid choice.
Round 15: Available cues C. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 16: Available cues B, C. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 17: Available cues B, D. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 18: Available cues A, B. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 19: Available cues D. You chose letter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 20: Available cues A, C. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 21: Available cues C. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 22: Available cues A, D. You chose space and saw Invalid choice.
Round 23: Available cues A, B. You chose your and saw Invalid choice.
Round 24: Available cues B, C. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 25: Available cues D. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 26: Available cues A, C. You chose RETURN and saw Invalid choice.
Round 27: Available cues B, D. You chose SPACE and saw Invalid choice.

Round 6: Available cues A, B, C. You chose a and saw Invalid choice.
Round 7: Available cues A, C. You chose KEY and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues C. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.

Round 10: Available cues A, B. You chose . and saw Invalid choice.

ACCUMULATED_PROMPT:
----------------------------------------
You will play a game with 50 rounds.
In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 50 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues B. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues D. You chose but and saw Invalid choice.
Round 3: Available cues A, C. You chose enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 4: Available cues B, C. You chose END and saw Invalid choice.
Round 5: Available cues C. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 6: Available cues C, D. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 7: Available cues A, B, C. You chose , and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose << and saw Invalid choice.
Round 9: Available cues C, D. Based on previous observations, choose one cue by responding with just the letter. You press <<

One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 50 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.

Round 1: Available cues B. You chose Enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 2: Available cues D. You chose but and saw Invalid choice.
Round 3: Available cues A, C. You chose enter and saw Invalid choice.
Round 4: Available cues B, C. You chose END and saw Invalid choice.
Round 5: Available cues C. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 6: Available cues C, D. You chose ENTER and saw Invalid choice.
Round 7: Available cues A, B, C. You chose , and saw Invalid choice.
Round 8: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose << and saw Invalid choice.
Round 9: Available cues C, D. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 10: Available cues A, C, D. You chose . and saw Invalid choice.
Round 11: Available cues B, C, D. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 12: Available cues B. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 13: Available cues A, C, D. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 14: Available cues A, B, C, D. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 15: Available cues B, C. You chose too and saw Invalid choice.
Round 16: Available cues D. You chose , and saw Invalid choice.
Round 17: Available cues A, C, D. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 18: Available cues C. You chose and and saw Invalid choice.
Round 19: Available cues A, B. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 20: Available cues B, D. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 21: Available cues A, B, C. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 22: Available cues C. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 23: Available cues B, C. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 24: Available cues A, B. You chose to and saw Invalid choice.
Round 25: Available cues A, C, D. You chose or and saw Invalid choice.

In each round you'll see active cues (chooseable):
One quadrant has 90% one color/10% other
Other quadrants have 50/50 color distribution
At least one cue active per round
Active cues disappear after random duration

After 50 rounds, identify the biased quadrant.
Correct: +100 points, Wrong: -100 points.
